intro: Corymbium rogersii, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a mat-forming growth habit. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Corymbium rogersii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
